intro: Platydesma remyi, commonly known as the silverleaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually broad and glossy, with a silvery sheen that gives it its common name. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink.
